description: A small but venomous freshwater catfish found across South and Southeast Asia. Known for its sharp dorsal spines that deliver venom, it feeds on insects, small fish, and detritus, using agility and venomous strikes to defend itself.
name: Asian Stinging Catfish

description: A widely distributed freshwater fish native to Africa but introduced worldwide. Tilapia are omnivorous and highly adaptable, feeding on plants, insects, and small invertebrates. Their hardiness and schooling behavior make them resilient in rivers, lakes, and reservoirs.
name: Nile Tilapia

description: A small freshwater fish native to South and Southeast Asia, often found in rivers, swamps, and flooded fields. Swamp Barbs are fast, schooling fish that feed on insects, small crustaceans, and plant matter.
name: Swamp Barb

description: A large freshwater carp native to rivers and lakes of South Asia. Catla are primarily surface feeders, consuming plankton and small fish. They are fast-growing and form an important part of riverine and aquaculture ecosystems.
name: Catla

description: A major freshwater carp of South Asia, Rohu is an important species for rivers, lakes, and aquaculture. It feeds on plankton and plant matter, growing large and forming dense schools that provide both food and ecological balance.
name: Rohu

description: A large freshwater eel native to rivers, lakes, and estuaries of eastern Australia. Longfin Eels are nocturnal predators, feeding on fish, crustaceans, and invertebrates. They are renowned for their endurance, ability to migrate long distances, and slippery, agile movements.
name: Australian Longfin Eel

description: A medium-sized freshwater eel found in rivers, lakes, and estuaries across Australia and New Zealand. Shortfin Eels are nocturnal predators, feeding on fish, insects, and crustaceans. They are known for their quick movements and ability to navigate complex aquatic environments.
name: Australian Shortfin Eel

description: A freshwater predator native to rivers and lakes across Africa. African Pike are solitary hunters, feeding on smaller fish and invertebrates. They rely on stealth and sudden bursts of speed to ambush prey, making them agile and formidable hunters in their habitats.
name: African Pike

description: A large freshwater predator native to rivers, lakes, and marshes across North America, Europe, and parts of Asia. Northern Pike are ambush hunters, feeding on fish, amphibians, and occasionally small mammals. Their speed and sharp teeth make them top predators in their ecosystems.
name: Northern Pike

description: A freshwater predator native to rivers and lakes of North America. Walleye are known for their excellent vision in low light and feed on smaller fish, insects, and crustaceans. They are agile hunters, often striking under the cover of darkness.
name: Walleye

description: A predatory fish of coastal and estuarine waters in the western Atlantic and Caribbean. Pikehandle Barracudas are fast, aggressive hunters, feeding on smaller fish with sudden bursts of speed. They are agile and rely on ambush tactics to capture prey.
name: Pikehandle Barracuda

description: A powerful predator of tropical and subtropical oceans worldwide, the Great Barracuda is known for its torpedo-like body and fearsome jaws. With lightning-fast strikes and sharp teeth, it preys on fish, squid, and occasionally smaller marine animals. Its intimidating presence has earned it a reputation as one of the ocean’s most aggressive hunters.
name: Great Barracuda

description: A large freshwater predator native to rivers, lakes, and marshes across North America, Europe, and parts of Asia. Northern Pike are ambush hunters, feeding on fish, amphibians, and occasionally small mammals. Their speed and sharp teeth make them top predators in their ecosystems.
name: Beluga Sturgeon

description: The largest freshwater fish in North America, the White Sturgeon can live for over a century and reach massive sizes. Dwelling in deep rivers and estuaries, it feeds on fish, mollusks, and crustaceans. Its slow but deliberate movements are backed by tremendous strength, making it a dominant presence in its habitat.
name: White Sturgeon

description: A colorful predatory cichlid native to South America, especially the Amazon Basin. The Butterfly Peacock Bass is admired for its bright patterns and aggressive hunting style. It feeds on fish and crustaceans, striking with speed and precision. Popular among anglers, it’s both a beautiful and formidable freshwater predator.
name: Butterfly Peacock Bass

description: A fast, predatory mackerel found in the coastal and estuarine waters of the South China Sea and surrounding regions. Known for its streamlined body and sharp teeth, the Chinese Seerfish preys on small fish and squid, relying on bursts of speed to ambush and chase down its meals. It is a prized fish for both commercial fishing and sport.
name: Chinese Seerfish

description: The largest of the Pacific salmon, Chinook are powerful swimmers known for their epic migrations from the ocean into freshwater rivers to spawn. They are opportunistic predators, feeding on smaller fish, squid, and crustaceans in the ocean before expending their strength in upriver journeys. Highly valued for both their ecological role and as a prized catch.
name: Chinook Salmon

description: Also called the Silver Salmon, the Coho is a smaller but agile member of the Pacific salmon family. Known for its silvery body and powerful jumps, it thrives in both marine and freshwater environments. Coho feed on fish and invertebrates in the ocean before migrating upriver to spawn, where they display bright red coloration.
name: Coho Salmon

description: A highly adaptable freshwater predator native to North America, Largemouth Bass are one of the most popular sport fish worldwide. They thrive in lakes, rivers, and swamps, using stealth and sudden bursts of speed to prey on fish, frogs, insects, and even small birds. Their aggressive feeding behavior makes them formidable hunters in their habitats.
name: Largemouth Bass

description: A striking and aggressive predatory fish from the Orinoco River Basin, the Orinoco Peacock Bass is renowned for its vivid coloration and fierce hunting style. It preys primarily on smaller fish, using ambush tactics and explosive bursts of speed. Highly prized by anglers, it is one of the most iconic freshwater game fish of South America.
name: Orinoco Peacock Bass

description: A powerful predatory jack of the Indo-Pacific, the Giant Trevally dominates coral reefs, coastal zones, and open waters. It hunts both alone and in groups, preying on fish, squid, and even birds, known for its explosive bursts of speed and raw power. Revered as a trophy fish, it is considered one of the toughest fighters in the ocean.
name: Giant Trevally

description: A deepwater predator found across the Indo-Pacific, the Ruby Snapper is known for its striking reddish coloration and adaptability to depths over 100 meters. Feeding on fish, squid, and crustaceans, it is both a skilled hunter and a valuable commercial fish. Its endurance and strength make it a respected inhabitant of reef slopes and offshore waters.
name: Ruby Snapper

description: A fast-growing freshwater carp native to East Asia. Silver Carp feed primarily on plankton and detritus, forming dense schools that can impact river ecosystems. Though peaceful, their size and numbers make them ecologically dominant in many rivers and lakes.
name: Silver Carp

description: Also called Huchen, the Danube Salmon is a large, predatory salmonid native to the Danube and other European rivers. It feeds on fish, insects, and small amphibians, using stealth and bursts of speed to ambush prey. Considered a trophy fish, it is one of Europe’s most iconic freshwater predators.
name: Danube Salmon

description: The largest salmonid in the world, the Siberian Taimen inhabits rivers across Siberia and Mongolia. A solitary apex predator, it feeds on fish, small mammals, and birds, striking with immense power and speed. Its size, strength, and endurance make it a dominant force in cold freshwater ecosystems.
name: Siberian Taimen

description: A medium-sized gar native to freshwater rivers, lakes, and swamps of Florida. Florida Gars are ambush predators, feeding on fish, crustaceans, and insects. Their elongated body and armored scales make them resilient hunters in shallow waters.
name: Florida Gar

description: A large North American gar, the Longnose Gar inhabits rivers, lakes, and bayous. Known for its elongated snout filled with sharp teeth, it is an ambush predator feeding on fish, crustaceans, and occasionally small amphibians. Its armored scales provide strong protection against attacks.
name: Longnose Gar

description: A medium-sized North American gar found in rivers, lakes, and swamps. Spotted Gars are ambush predators feeding on fish, insects, and crustaceans. Their distinctive spots help them blend into murky waters, making them effective stealth hunters.
name: Spotted Gar

description: A large, critically endangered sawfish found in coastal and riverine waters of the Indo-Pacific. It uses its long, toothed snout to detect and incapacitate prey such as fish and crustaceans. Despite its slow swimming speed, its strength and specialized rostrum make it a formidable predator.
name: Green Sawfish

description: One of the largest and most powerful sawfish species, the Largetooth Sawfish inhabits rivers, estuaries, and coastal waters worldwide. It uses its long, toothed snout to stun and incapacitate fish and crustaceans. Despite being slow-moving, its immense strength and armored body make it a top predator in its habitats.
name: Largetooth Sawfish

description: A common freshwater fish of North America, found in rivers, lakes, and reservoirs. Gizzard Shad feed on plankton and detritus, forming large schools that help protect them from predators. Though small, they are ecologically important as a primary food source for larger fish and birds.
name: American Gizzard Shad

description: A large freshwater fish native to North American rivers and lakes. Bigmouth Buffalo are primarily filter feeders, consuming plankton and detritus. They can grow very large and are long-lived, making them an important species in freshwater ecosystems.
name: Bigmouth Buffalo

description: A small sturgeon native to rivers of Eastern Europe and Western Asia. Sterlets feed on small fish, invertebrates, and detritus. Though much smaller than other sturgeons, they are valued for their caviar and play a role in maintaining river ecosystem balance.
name: Sterlet

description: A large coastal and estuarine fish found along the Atlantic and Gulf coasts of North America. Black Drum feed on crustaceans, mollusks, and small fish, using their strong jaws to crush prey. They are slow-moving but resilient, making them a notable predator in their habitats.
name: Black Drum

description: A large freshwater sturgeon native to North American lakes and rivers. Lake Sturgeon are slow but powerful, feeding on fish, mollusks, and crustaceans. Known for their longevity and size, they are important apex fish in their habitats.
name: Lake Sturgeon

description: A gelatinous deep-sea fish found off the coasts of Australia and Tasmania. Smooth-head Blobfish are adapted to high-pressure environments and feed on small invertebrates. Their soft body makes them highly resilient to crushing pressure but slow-moving.
name: Smooth-head Blobfish

description: A small freshwater sunfish native to North America. Bluegill are schooling fish feeding on insects, small crustaceans, and plankton. They are agile and form the base of many freshwater food chains.
name: Bluegill

description: A primitive freshwater predator native to North American rivers, lakes, and swamps. Bowfins feed on fish, amphibians, and crustaceans. They are ambush predators with strong, elongated bodies and sharp teeth, making them effective hunters in their habitats.
name: Bowfin

description: A small to medium-sized freshwater catfish native to North America. Brown Bullheads are bottom feeders, eating insects, small fish, and detritus. They are hardy and adapt well to various freshwater environments, including rivers, lakes, and swamps.
name: Brown Bullhead Catfish

description: One of the largest catfish in the Amazon, the Piraiba inhabits rivers and lakes across South America. A powerful predator, it feeds on fish and small aquatic animals, using its immense size and strength to dominate its environment.
name: Piraiba

description: A small to medium freshwater catfish native to Southeast Asia. Walking Catfish are known for their ability to traverse land in search of water. They feed on fish, insects, and detritus, making them versatile predators in their habitats.
name: Walking Catfish

description: The fastest land animal on Earth, native to African savannahs and grasslands. Cheetahs rely on explosive speed and agility to hunt antelope and other small to medium prey. Despite their incredible speed, they have moderate stamina and low defense.
name: African Cheetah

description: A small African mammal related to hyenas, feeding primarily on termites and insects. Aardwolves are nocturnal and rely on stealth to forage.
name: Aardwolf

description: A medium-sized wild cat native to West and Central African forests. African Golden Cats are elusive and skilled hunters, feeding on birds, small mammals, and reptiles.
name: African Golden Cat

description: A large apex predator native to African savannahs. Lions hunt cooperatively in prides, feeding on herbivores like zebras and antelopes. Known for strength, teamwork, and dominance in their ecosystem.
name: African Lion

description: A massive herbivore native to North American plains. Bison are social animals that graze on grasses and can defend themselves with strength and horns.
name: American Bison

description: A medium to large North American bear found in forests and river valleys. Omnivorous and versatile, black bears feed on plants, insects, fish, and mammals.
name: American Black Bear

description: A small deep-sea shark found in North Atlantic waters. Longnose Velvet Dogfish feed on fish and cephalopods, adapted to deep, dark environments with slow swimming and ambush tactics.
name: Longnose Velvet Dogfish

description: A deep-sea cartilaginous fish found in the North Pacific. Silver Chimaeras feed on smaller fish and invertebrates, using stealth and slow ambush attacks in deep waters.
name: Silver Chimaera

description: A small tropical sawshark native to coastal waters and reefs. It uses its toothed snout to detect and slash fish and crustaceans.
name: Tropical Sawshark

description: A small fish that attaches to larger marine animals like whales and sharks. Whalesuckers feed on parasites and scraps, gaining mobility and protection from their hosts.
name: Whalesucker

description: A large ray inhabiting coral reefs and coastal waters of the Indo-Pacific. Reef Manta Rays feed on plankton and small fish while gliding gracefully, using size to deter predators.
name: Reef Manta Ray

description: The largest species of manta ray, found in open oceans worldwide. Feeds on plankton and small fish, using massive size to dominate its territory.
name: Giant Oceanic Manta Ray

description: A ray species inhabiting coral reefs and coastal areas of the Indo-Pacific. Feeds on crustaceans and small fish, using gliding movements to ambush prey.
name: Duckbill Eagle Ray

description: A large ray found in tropical and subtropical reefs. White-spotted Eagle Rays feed on mollusks and crustaceans, using powerful tail strikes and gliding to hunt.
name: White-spotted Eagle Ray

description: One of the largest bony fish, Ocean Sunfish inhabit open oceans worldwide. They feed on jellyfish and plankton and rely on size and thick skin for protection.
name: Ocean Sunfish

description: A freshwater salmonid native to Siberian and East Asian rivers. Lenok feed on smaller fish and invertebrates, using speed and ambush tactics in cold waters.
name: Manchurian Trout

description: A large freshwater catfish resembling a small crocodile. Crocodile Catfish are apex predators, feeding on fish, amphibians, and small mammals in rivers and lakes.
name: Crocodile Catfish

description: A venomous snake native to the highlands of southeastern Australia. Highland Copperheads hunt small mammals, birds, and amphibians, using stealth and venom to immobilize prey.
name: Highland Copperhead

description: A wild pig native to the Togian Islands of Indonesia. Known for its distinctive tusks and strong body, it feeds on roots, fruits, and small animals in forests and swamps.
name: Togian Babirusa

description: An African carnivore known for cooperative hunting in packs. African Wild Dogs hunt antelopes and other medium-sized prey, relying on stamina, teamwork, and strategy.
name: African Wild Dog

description: A wild dog native to Australia, dingoes are adaptable hunters feeding on mammals, birds, and reptiles. They are fast, intelligent, and opportunistic predators.
name: Dingo

description: A carnivorous marsupial native to Tasmania. Tasmanian Devils feed on carrion and small animals, known for powerful jaws, aggressive behavior, and loud screeches.
name: Tasmanian Devil

description: A large seabird found along the Pacific Coast of North America. Brandts Cormorants are skilled divers, feeding on fish and invertebrates under the sea.
name: Brandts Cormorant

description: A widespread North American waterbird that dives underwater to catch fish. They thrive in lakes, rivers, and coasts.
name: Double-crested Cormorant

abilities: Kelp Forager  Gains defense and regeneration bonus when in kelp forests.
description: A marine mammal native to the North Pacific, sea otters are known for tool use and feeding on shellfish while floating in kelp forests.
name: Sea Otter

abilities: Regenerator  Recovers health when in tidepools.
description: A starfish species of the North Pacific. It feeds on sponges and other invertebrates and is recognizable by its leathery texture.
name: Leather Star

abilities: Tidepool Titan  Gains defense when holding ground in rocky shores.
description: A keystone predator in intertidal ecosystems, feeding on mussels and barnacles. Found on rocky Pacific shores.
name: Ochre Sea Star

abilities: Spiny Defense  Gains high defense when stationary.
description: A spiny echinoderm inhabiting tidepools and kelp forests. Purple Sea Urchins feed on algae and can drastically shape ecosystems.
name: Purple Sea Urchin

abilities: Armor Spines  Boosts defense when under attack.
description: One of the largest sea urchins, found in the Pacific. Red Sea Urchins feed on kelp and are important in marine ecosystems.
name: Red Sea Urchin

abilities: Multi-limbed Hunter  Gains attack bonus when swarming prey with many arms.
description: A massive starfish with up to 24 arms, found in the North Pacific. It preys on sea urchins, clams, and other invertebrates.
name: Sunflower Star

abilities: Filter Forager  Gains health recovery when scavenging detritus.
description: A small, brightly colored sea star native to the Pacific coast. Bat Stars feed on detritus and algae.
name: Bat Star

abilities: Tidepool Forager  Gains minor regeneration in shallow waters.
description: A small red starfish found along the Pacific coast. Blood Stars primarily feed on sponges and microorganisms.
name: Blood Star

abilities: Cushion Defense  Inflates to deter predators, gaining defense.
description: A thick-bodied starfish found in the Pacific. Its puffed-up appearance provides protection from predators.
name: Cushion Star

abilities: Six-limbed Grasp  Gains better hold on prey with six arms.
description: A small starfish of the Pacific Northwest intertidal zone. Known for its six arms and predation on mussels and barnacles.
name: Six-rayed Starfish

abilities: Swift Hunter  Gains speed and attack when chasing schooling fish.
description: A small houndshark of the Eastern Pacific, feeding on fish and invertebrates.
name: Brown Smoothhound Shark

abilities: Schooling Predator  Gains attack bonus when hunting in groups.
description: A large schooling fish found in the Eastern Pacific. Known for speed and strength, often targeted by fishers.
name: California Yellowtail

abilities: Striped Stalker  Gains stealth and attack in shallow waters.
description: A small shark species with spotted patterns, found along the Pacific Coast of North America.
name: Leopard Shark

abilities: Apex Predator  Gains huge attack bonus when ambushing large prey.
description: One of the ocean's most feared predators, Great Whites are massive sharks found worldwide in temperate waters.
name: Great White Shark

abilities: Electric Surge  Can paralyze enemies with electric shocks.
description: An electric ray native to the Pacific coast of North America. It uses strong electrical discharges to stun prey and deter predators.
name: Pacific Electric Ray

abilities: Camouflage Predator  Gains stealth and attack bonus when hiding in rocky reefs.
description: A large sculpin native to the Pacific coast, known for ambushing prey among rocks and kelp.
name: Cabezon

abilities: Kelp Shelter  Gains defense and evasion when hiding in kelp forests.
description: A fish species inhabiting rocky reefs and kelp forests along the Pacific Coast.

name: Lesser Rhea

description: American White Pelicans catch fish with their large pouches. They often feed cooperatively in shallow waters.
name: American White Pelican

description: Australasian Gannets dive from great heights to catch fish. They feed in large flocks, using precision and speed to secure prey.
name: Australasian Gannet

description: Australian Pelicans catch fish in shallow waters using their pouches. They often feed in groups to increase success rates.
name: Australian Pelican

description: Maguari Storks hunt fish and small amphibians in wetland habitats. They often forage in loose social groups.
name: Maguari Stork

description: Northern Gannets are plunge-diving predators that hunt fish in open oceans. They feed in large colonies for safety and coordination.
name: Northern Gannet

description: Royal Albatrosses are oceanic predators with the longest wingspans of any birds. They glide for hours to locate fish and squid.
name: Royal Albatross

description: Trumpeter Swans forage on aquatic vegetation and small animals. Their large size and social behavior help protect them from predators.
name: Trumpeter Swan

description: Great Bastards are enormous pelicans that hunt fish with large pouches. They are mostly solitary but highly effective predators.
name: Great Bastard

description: Kori Bastards use their powerful beaks to hunt fish and small amphibians. Their large size makes them dominant in wetland habitats.
name: Kori Bastard

description: The electric blue ram is a vividly colored freshwater fish with an energetic temperament. It forms pairs and defends its territory with surprising intensity.
name: Electric Blue Ram

description: The elephant shrew darts through dry grasslands with lightning speed. Its long nose helps it sniff out insects and seeds on the ground.
name: Elephant Shrew

description: The bar-headed goose flies higher than almost any bird, soaring over the Himalayas. Its lungs are specially adapted for thin, cold air.
name: Bar-headed Goose

description: The black swan is both elegant and fiercely territorial. It glides across still waters, defending its mate and cygnets with strong wings.
name: Black Swan

description: The Cape Barren goose feeds on coastal grasses and can drink salty water. Despite its bulky frame, it is a capable flyer and strong walker.
name: Cape Barren Goose

description: The whooper swan is known for its powerful, echoing call that carries over lakes. Its strong pair bonds last for life, ensuring loyalty and harmony.
name: Whooper Swan

description: The Australian brush turkey builds large nesting mounds to incubate eggs. It carefully maintains temperature by adding or removing leaves.
name: Australian Brush Turkey

description: Denhams bustard blends perfectly into the dry grasslands it inhabits. Males perform elaborate dances to attract mates during breeding season.
name: Denhams Bastard

description: The southern screamers loud cry echoes for miles across wetlands. Its spurred wings and strong legs make it a formidable defender.
name: Southern Screamer

description: The arowana tetra is a sleek predator that hunts near the waters surface. Its quick leaps help it snatch insects mid-air.
name: Arowana Tetra

description: The Atlantic hagfish feeds on dead or dying sea creatures by burrowing inside them. It releases thick slime to escape predators.
name: Atlantic Hagfish

description: The Atlantic icefish thrives in freezing waters thanks to blood proteins that prevent ice crystals. Its translucent skin and blood make it eerie and unique.
name: Atlantic Icefish

description: Daphnia, or water fleas, are minute crustaceans that drift through freshwater. They are vital food sources for fish and amphibians.
name: Daphnia

description: The dragon snakehead is a powerful predator lurking beneath still waters. Its fierce jaws and bold coloration earn it its mythical name.
name: Dragon Snakehead

description: The fire dartfish darts between coral crevices with flashing colors. Its split tail helps it make rapid turns to avoid predators.
name: Fire Dartfish

description: The peacock gudgeon is a small, vibrantly colored fish found in New Guinea streams. Males flare their fins to impress potential mates.
name: Peacock Gudgeon

description: The polka-dot batfish uses its fins to walk along the seafloor instead of swimming. Its odd appearance and pattern make it blend into sandy bottoms.
name: Polka-dot Batfish

description: The armadillo girdled lizard curls into a ball to protect its belly from predators. Its spiny scales form a nearly impenetrable armor.
name: Armadillo Girdled Lizard

description: The goblin shark is a living fossil lurking in the ocean depths. Its extendable jaw shoots forward to snatch unsuspecting prey.
name: Goblin Shark

description: The hellbender is a giant salamander that breathes through its wrinkled skin. It hides beneath rocks, feeding on crayfish and small fish.
name: Hellbender Salamander

description: The leaf-tailed gecko is a master of disguise, mimicking dead leaves perfectly. It waits motionless until insects stray within striking distance.
name: Leaf-tailed Gecko

description: The ornate flying snake flattens its body and glides from tree to tree. Its mild venom helps subdue small prey in the canopy.
name: Ornate Flying Snake

description: The longhorn cowfish sports bony horns and a box-shaped body. When stressed, it releases toxins that deter predators.
name: Longhorn Cowfish

description: The mandarin dragonet is famed for its brilliant blue and orange patterns. It glides gracefully along coral reefs, feeding on tiny crustaceans.
name: Mandarin Dragonet

description: The ocellated dragonet has eye-like spots that confuse predators. It skims gently over coral sands in search of small prey.
name: Ocellated Dragonet

description: This peculiar fish uses its fins to walk on the sea floor rather than swim. Its bright red lips are used for species recognition and mate attraction.
moves: Tail Slam, Fin Slap, Bubble Burst, Dive
name: Red-lipped Batfish

description: This brilliantly colored dragonet is found only in select coral reefs of the Philippines. Its vivid red scales make it nearly invisible in the red light of deep water.
moves: Fin Slash, Bubble Spin, Coral Shield, Water Dash
name: Ruby Red Dragonet

description: This mantis mimics the petals of a flower to ambush prey with deadly precision. Its threat display is one of the most spectacular in the insect world.
name: Devils Flower Mantis

description: This assassin bug hunts bedbugs and other small insects within homes. Its venomous bite can paralyze small prey in seconds.
name: Masked Hunter

description: The orchid mantis perfectly mimics orchid petals to lure pollinators. Its beauty hides a predatory nature that strikes with lightning speed.
name: Orchid Mantis

description: This insects peanut-shaped head startles predators and confuses attackers. Its patterned wings resemble a snake when opened.
name: Peanut-headed Lanternfly

description: An invasive species that feeds on sap and damages trees. Its spotted wings and rapid flight make it easily recognizable.
name: Spotted Lanternfly

description: This strange insect bears a massive horn-like spine on its back. It uses its body shape to blend seamlessly with thorny twigs.
name: Thorn Bug

description: A powerful predatory insect capable of killing prey much larger than itself. Its bright coloration serves as a warning of its venomous sting.
name: Yellow Tiger Assassin Bug

description: The male performs elaborate dances with vibrant plumes to attract females. Its courtship displays are among the most complex in nature.
name: Greater Bird-of-paradise

description: This striking vulture feeds primarily on carrion deep in tropical forests. Its bright orange and purple head distinguishes it from all other vultures.
name: King Vulture

description: This birds long white tail ribbons trail gracefully during flight displays. Found only in Papua New Guinea, it is a symbol of rarity and beauty.
name: Ribbon-tailed Astrapia

description: This leaf-eating bird digests food using fermentation similar to cows. Its chicks have claws on their wings to climb back into nests.
name: Hoatzin

description: A goat-antelope that roams the dense Japanese forests. Its thick coat and sturdy frame help it navigate rocky slopes with ease.
name: Japanese Serow

description: The worlds only flightless parrot, critically endangered and nocturnal. It uses scent trails instead of flight to move through dense forest.
name: Kakapo

description: This eusocial rodent lives in underground colonies ruled by a single queen. It can survive with extremely low oxygen levels.
name: Naked Mole Rat

description: Despite its name, this animal is not a lemur but a colugo. It glides effortlessly through the treetops of Southeast Asia.
name: Sunda Flying Lemur

description: This long-legged wolf hunts small prey across open grasslands. Its eerie night calls echo through the South American plains.
name: Maned Wolf

description: The smallest armadillo species, rarely seen above ground. Its soft pink shell and delicate claws make it a desert mystery.
name: Pink Fairy Armadillo

description: Despite appearances, this reptile is a legless lizard, not a snake. It can detach and regrow its tail when threatened.
name: Slender Glass Lizard

description: This nocturnal primate moves silently through the trees. Its large eyes give it exceptional low-light vision for hunting insects.
name: Slender Loris

description: This tiny squid houses glowing bacteria in its body for camouflage. It buries itself in sand during the day and hunts at night.
name: Bobtail Squid

description: This turtle breathes partially through its skin and mouth lining. Its soft shell and long snout make it a stealthy ambush predator.
name: Chinese Softshell Turtle

description: This turtle can absorb oxygen through glands near its tail. Its green algae-covered head gives it a punk-like appearance.
name: Mary River Turtle

description: This worm can stretch to extreme lengths, sometimes exceeding 30 meters. It secretes a toxin to subdue small prey.
name: Ribbon Worm

description: This bizarre deep-sea creature feeds on organic debris in the abyss. Its inflated body and tube feet help it crawl across soft sediment.
name: Sea Pig

description: The fossa is Madagascars top predator, resembling both cat and mongoose. It hunts lemurs with incredible agility through the canopy.
name: Fossa

description: This long-necked antelope feeds on leaves other grazers cant reach. It often stands upright on its hind legs to browse tall shrubs.
name: Gerenuk

description: This large rodent looks like a cross between a rabbit and a deer. It lives in monogamous pairs and runs swiftly across the plains.
name: Patagonian Mara

description: Dubbed the Asian unicorn, this elusive animal was discovered only in 1992. It is one of the rarest and most mysterious mammals on Earth.
name: Saola
